result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LACEY R SIMON

defendant.name: SIMON, LACEY R
defendant.address: 111 N ELM ST, BLACK CREEK, WI 54106

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: plus $1000signature bond. No contact with Lloyd Tourtillott. Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. No entry into any Class B licensed establishments. No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

1:13 PM Defendant LACEY R SIMON appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joe Furnstahl appeared by video for LACEY R SIMON.  Prosecuting attorney Mark s Williams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for PD services but they will have to appoint. State asks for $500 cash bond with conditions.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
